Overview: Cities often provide diverse forage and surprisingly high honey yields. Studies show urban hives sometimes outperform rural counterparts.
Set-up & Good Neighbour Policy: Flight barriers, water sources, and hive placement are critical to avoid nuisance. Local councils may require setbacks or permissions.
Management in Urban Context: Varroa control, swarm prevention, and responsible inspections are essential in dense areas where hives cannot be moved easily.
Debates & Evidence: Some ecologists question whether urban honeybees compete with wild pollinators. Most evidence suggests coexistence is possible when forage is sufficient.
